title: Maybe I'll Come Home in the Spring

sources.title: Maybe I'll Come Home in the Spring
sources.description: Dennie (Sally Field) has returned from a year among the hippies to her superficial, image-conscious suburban family. She must face their disapproval of her actions. They refuse to even try to understand. She must also deal with an ex-lover (David Carradine), and a beloved young sister (Lane Bradbury) who is following in her footsteps, wanting the idealistic hippie life but making some rash decisions in the process.

sources.title: Maybe I'll Come Home in the Spring (1971) Sally Field, David Carradine
sources.description:
A story of powerful love...and understanding!
Sally Field stars as Denise "Dennie" Miller, a teenage girl who runs away to live among hippies and then returns to her superficial suburban family home, facing disapproval and judgment for her choices. Her younger sister Susie wants to follow in her footsteps, chasing the idealistic hippie life. David Carradine plays Dennie's ex-boyfriend who tries to win her back. The film is a period piece portraying the challenges of reconciling personal freedom with familial expectations, often facing generational differences of the late 1960s and early 1970s.

Original title: Maybe I'll Come Home in the Spring (1971) AKA: Deadly Desire
This film has subtitles in many language options.

Director: Joseph Sargent
Writer: Bruce Feldman
Stars: Sally Field, Eleanor Parker, Lane Bradbury, David Carradine
Genres: Drama, Made for TV
Music: Linda Ronstadt is heard on several of the songs used in the film.


0:00:00 Full movie with subtitles 
0:06:20 Denise “Dennie” Miller returns home at dawn, exhausted from her year on the road.
0:08:45 Susie discovers Dennie in her old bedroom, sparking a tense family reunion.
0:18:10 Dennie cuts her hair and tries to reclaim her childhood innocence.
0:27:55 Flack, Dennie’s ex-boyfriend, steals a truck and sets out to find her.
0:37:20 Ed and Claire Miller search Susie’s room for drugs, igniting a family argument.
0:47:05 Dennie finds Susie’s hidden pills and warns her sister about the dangers of drugs.
0:56:30 Susie crashes the parents’ party in a drug-fueled outburst, and Dennie dives into the pool to escape the chaos.
1:08:00 Flack urges Dennie to run away with him, but she refuses as Susie disappears into the night.
